revised_title: Infectious Cattle Disease and Lime Burial
tldr: This article discusses a debate on whether burying cows dead from an infectious disease in lime is effective in preventing the spread of the disease. The author presents a case study where cows buried with lime attracted dogs due to the fermentation of lime, whereas cows buried without lime did not. The author hopes this information will prevent the practice of burying cows with lime in the future.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Veterinary Medicine
